body_html: It is known that int 64 index support is not well supported in many of our ops. the workaround is to cast to tf.int32 (with tf.cast) or in this case since it is a constant use tf.int32. If you are using over 2 billion entry tensors, then you might need to work on adding the support. @vrv, has some ideas on how to handle this more elegantly.

If you are using over 2 billion entry tensors, then you might need to work on adding the support. @vrv, has some ideas on how to handle this more elegantly.
body: It is known that int 64 index support is not well supported in many of our ops. the workaround is to cast to tf.int32 (with tf.cast) or in this case since it is a constant use  tf.int32. If you are using over 2 billion entry tensors, then you might need to work on adding the support. @vrv, has some ideas on how to handle this more elegantly.
